programme.desc: A crystal that can restore the Andromeda's power is discovered, but in order to get it, Dylan must work for the mine's owner.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Looking for Justice
programme.desc: This week, for the first time ever, the prime suspect in a murder enquiry has turned to Sensing Murder for help.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Into Thin Air
programme.desc: Jim Donnelly was a hard-working family man living a quiet life in suburban Auckland. For 20 years he’d worked as a scientist at the Glenbrook Steel Mill, south of Auckland. On the 21st of June 2004, he simply vanished into thin air.

programme.title: Sensing Murder
programme.desc: “Sensing Murder” psychics are challenged to connect with the spirit of 53-year-old, Cynthia Greenwood-Smith, to unravel the lies and discover the grim truth surrounding her disappearance from her Gold Coast home in 2001.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Where There's Smoke
programme.desc: In 2006, 19-year-old Blake Stott died in a mysterious car fire. Blake had seemingly pulled into a South Otago lay-by to have a sleep, when his late-model, un-modified car burst into flames.

programme.title: Sensing Murder
programme.desc: Our new team of “ Sensing Murder” psychics are challenged to unmask the killer – or killers – of vivacious New Zealand hairdresser Paula Brown who was plucked from Sydney’s downtown after a night out with friends.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Wanda Beach Murders / The Beaumont Children Mystery
programme.desc: In 1965, when Australian teenage culture was centred on sun, sand, and surf, the nation was shocked by the brutal bashing, rape and murder of two 15-year-old girls in the sand hills at Sydney's Wanda Beach.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Night Caller: Eric Edgar Cooke
programme.desc: In 1959, the carefree culture of Perth changed forever when a plague of crime hit the city. By early 1963, the crime wave had escalated to serial murder.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Girls Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: Sallie-Anne Huckstepp and Juanita Nielsen were iconic figures in the shadowy King’s Cross scene of the 1970s and 1980s. They lived dangerous lives – challenging the status quo of the period and met with mysterious and violent deaths.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: No More Grannies / The Granny Killer
programme.desc: We delve into the twisted mind of one of Australia's most prolific serial murderers. John Wayne Glover - The Granny Killer, was truly an evil man.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Blood Sport: The Bondi Gay Murders
programme.desc: In the late 1980s and early 1990s a series of violent murders took place near Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Jodi and Stevie are not getting on well, with Jodi fed up at what she sees as Stevie’s unnecessary risky behaviour.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Alex is taken by surprise when his first love, Tracey Morrison, arrives at Killarney.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: While excitedly preparing for Charlotte’s first birthday party, Tess receives a process server from Peter Johnson, Charlotte’s biological father, demanding custody. Distressed, Tess calls on the Ryans for help.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: As Tess tries to come to terms with the custody battle for Charlotte, the re-opening of a long forgotten well on Drovers Run brings to the surface some ghosts from the past.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Drover’s has a squatter problem: somebody is lighting campfires. While tracking the culprit, Stevie (Simmone Jade Mackinnon) comes to grips with a mysterious and handsome stranger whom it turns out is her ex-husband, Jarred (Grant Bowler).

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: It’s sale day and Tess (Bridie Carter) is in a hurry to register her cattle so that they can get the best price. The truck stop is crowded with people wanting to do exactly the same thing.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Phantom For the First Course
programme.desc: A renowned restaurant, The Whitney, once owned by a lumber baron in the 1800's, might still have family members hanging around its halls. Renovations and construction around the property could be behind the uprising of spirits.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Children in the Attic
programme.desc: One of the oldest yacht clubs in the USA is also one of the most haunted! A mother and her son are entangled in phenomena involving a frightening family from the past with a strange story to tell.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Paranormal Pirates
programme.desc: Fear is spreading at Fort Taber-Fort Rodmanthat a new \\"living history event\\" has stirred up frightening paranormal activity on the park grounds.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Fighting Spirit
programme.desc: TAPS has been called to investigate a historic armory. An upcoming renovation has those involved fearful the construction might provoke lingering spirits attached to artifacts with documented violent pasts.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Public Poltergeist Number 1
programme.desc: The historic Old Lake County Jail was once considered to be inescapable... until notorious gangster John Dillinger, escaped from it in 1934. Over 80 years later, aggressive prisoners are breaking free as sealed areas.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: All in the Family
programme.desc: Dog and the team need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives. The case is a family affair with both mother and daughter in trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mother Courage
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bounty Boot Camp
programme.desc: Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business. Today, Jim has asked Dog to track down a potentially dangerous fugitive, and take his son along for some training with the best in the world.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Friends and Neighbors
programme.desc: Dog and his posse head to Colorado for a special mission, to catch Marco, an alleged drug dealer. It's been ten months since Marco went on the lam, and his bondsman stands to lose his family business if Marco is not caught.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Set-Up
programme.desc: The trail is hot and the stakes is high for Dog and the posse. The "Big Fish" in this case is Marco, an alleged drug dealer with a big bond. But a major key to catching him is Elizabeth, who is also a fugitive from the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Searchers
programme.desc: Dog is still on the search for the elusive fugitive, Marco. Dog has been tracking him across Colorado, from Grand Junction to Denver, and now a hot tip that a long time associate of his is hiding in Pueblo sends the team racing south.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Inlawful Entry
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends. Meanwhile, Willie helps John Luke start his own snow cone business.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Flock and Key
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box. Meanwhile, Jase helps Mia prepare for her cheerleading competition, but the only problem is he has no idea.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Ball in the Family
programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all. Meanwhile, Si thinks his cat is cheating on him with another family, so he recruits Miss Kay.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Drone Survivor
programme.desc: When Jase and Phil make a bet about whether or not human beings in a duck blind are visible from the air, Jep buys a drone copter to get a "bird's eye" view, but ends up losing it in the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Alan in Charge
programme.desc: Jase and the guys convince Willie to hire his older brother Alan to work at Duck Commander, but when Alan begins micromanaging everyone, they quickly change their mind. Meanwhile, the ladies take a self-defense class and use John Luke as a punching bag.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Renaissance Men
programme.desc: When the Robertsons throw a Renaissance Fair birthday party for Godwin, various family members compete in a tournament to win knighthood.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Heroes Welcome
programme.desc: In this special episode, the Duck Commander team surprises two wounded veterans with a trip to Monroe so they can be in an episode of Duck Dynasty. To show their support, the Robertson family stages a color run to bring awareness to our wounded soldiers.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Pie Hard
programme.desc: Willie and Alan agree to help Miss Kay open her own bakery, but things take a turn when Kay is asked to hand over her secret recipes. Meanwhile, the guys in the duck call room take an extended lunch break by driving to Mississippi.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Van He'llsing
programme.desc: When Missy and Jase's son Reed purchases an old van to boost his music career, his parents begin to question some of his choices. Meanwhile, Willie helps Jep prepare River for a competitive wrestling league by introducing him to his friend.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Toad to Perdition
programme.desc: When Willie and his brothers spend too much time frog hunting, their wives challenge them to a "frogging" competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: RV There Yet?
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a road trip to Liberty University where they will drop off John Luke and Mary Kate for their first year of college. Along the way, they stop in Nashville to visit Willie's friend Colt Ford.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: When a Stranger Calls
programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call - The Dog!? And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Jack & Jill
programme.desc: Today's case is a twofer, a brother and sister both charged with drug related offenses. Also, Dog has crossed paths with the brother before. He once tried to stop Dog from arresting one of the most violent fugitives of his career.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Island Hopper
programme.desc: When a brother bondsman from Washington State calls Dog for help tracking a runner in search of fun in the sun on the tropical paradise of Kauai, the team gets on the case. Dog's only problem? No leads!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Nice Guys Finish Last
programme.desc: Dog and team help out a bondsman friend whose client jumped bail, but the target is a blank slate. Are his tattoos gang related? Is he likely to be violent? And making matters worse, when they hit his apartment they learn he is moving out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Back Behind Bars
programme.desc: While tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland struggles to find time to train and compete for his first boxing match in years.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Family Man
programme.desc: Dog and family head to Kona to track down a wanted father who's looking to bolt to the mainland to evade sentencing. Meanwhile, Dog does some evading of his own - Avoiding the much dreaded birthday party!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: All in the Family
programme.desc: Dog and the team need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives. The case is a family affair with both mother and daughter in trouble with the law.

programme.desc: After Froy bails him out from a Tijuana prison, Matt is on the warpath, and somebody needs to pay. Is this just the end of their business, or is it also the end of their friendship? Then, Lou and Sonia get an order for typical vehicle repossession...

programme.desc: Nikki blames herself for her favorite clown’s death.

programme.desc: A love potion causes chaos.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Suicide Possession
programme.desc: Joan and her boyfriend Tony are seeing apparitions in their New Jersey home. Both are concerned that the spirits are influencing their behavior: a non-drinker, Tony has turned to the bottle while Joan has thoughts of harming herself.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Knickerbocker
programme.desc: PRS checks into the Knickerbocker Hotel in Linesville, Pennsylvania where the owners are reporting strange noises and the appearance of phantom children in some of the rooms.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Glove
programme.desc: When a terrifying haunting threatens to break a Daisytown, PA couple apart, PRS is their last resort. As the investigation deepens, PRS and the family learn that it's just the tip of iceberg, turns out this haunting might be all in the family.

programme.title: Paranormal State: School House Haunting
programme.desc: PRS travels to Massachusetts to investigate an old schoolhouse where children's voices disturb a couple who've made it their home.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Supernatural Seduction
programme.desc: PRS investigates the Campbell House, where the Innkeeper and guests claim to have sexual encounters with a spirit who has deep ties to a family tragedy.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Good Vs. Evil
programme.desc: PRS visits a western Pennsylvania couple wracked by a torrent of paranormal activity.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Freshmen Fear
programme.desc: A young female student claims to have seen a ghost in her dorm room.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Invitation to Evil
programme.desc: Paula and her husband Mike are under siege by a purported shadow demon in their North Carolina home. Paula has witnessed a toddler bed levitating and heard deep growls. Michelle, Ryan and the team uncover the shocking truth behind the haunting.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Ghosts of the Forgotten
programme.desc: The PRS investigation into the haunted Lake County Poor House becomes a journey through one PRS team members? troubled past.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Devil's Hostage
programme.desc: When a woman has long scratch marks mysteriously appear on her back, PRS is called in to see if they are truly facing the devil. But her credibility is called into question, a struggle of another kind emerges for Ryan and the rest of the team.

programme.title: Most Haunted: The Fleece Inn
programme.desc: This old pup in the heart of West Yorkshire is said to be one of the Most Haunted places in England.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Haden Hill House Part 1
programme.desc: An old house in England’s West Midlands gives the Most Haunted team a night they will never forget.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Haden Hill House Part 2
programme.desc: The strange occurrences at Hayden Hill House switch up a gear as whatever is there seems now to be stalking the team with some terrifying results, at least for some of the crew it is proving too much.

programme.title: Most Haunted: The Old House
programme.desc: This week Yvette Fielding takes her Most Haunted team to Coalville and a house that is surrounded by mystery. The team seem to disturb the rest of some of its long-term residence as they battle through a night of terror.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Keithley Bus Museum
programme.desc: Once an old foundry, this large old building houses vehicles from a bygone era that are said to still contain passengers whose destination has never ended.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Pilot - Part 1
programme.desc: In the series opener, we meet Jonathan Smith, a probationary angel who has been sent to help people on Earth. He befriends residents at a retirement home. The administrator at the home has a brother named Mark who is suspicious of Jonathan.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Pilot - Part 2
programme.desc: Jonathan helps the residents of Havencrest, when they learn that the retirement home is going to be sold. Jonathan must reveal his real identity to Mark in order to complete the assignment.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: To Touch The Moon
programme.desc: Jonathan helps a terminally ill boy and his mother. Meanwhile, Mark deals with a thief abandoned by his folks.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Return of the Masked Rider
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help aging movie heroes to stand up to a street gang known as Satan's Helpers. They persuade a young boxer not to throw a big fight when the gang tries to bully him.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Song of the Wild West
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark assist a young country singer who is hoping to follow in her mother's footsteps. Next, they help a widow mourning her late husband.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 8
programme.desc: Caroline returns to find that all is not well at Leopard's Den. Danny has been putting a brave face on his ban but his attempts at helping out around the house are getting on everyone's nerves and Alice is finding his back-seat vetting especially hard.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 9
programme.desc: Danny is delighted to have his veterinary license back again and being back at work is helping to distract him from the impending anniversary of Sarah's death.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 10
programme.desc: Du Plessis is restless after his heart surgery but the family insist he needs to relax. Meanwhile Danny and Alice are happy to have closed down a zoo down that has been mistreating animals.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 1
programme.desc: While on honeymoon in London, Alice discovers that Danny has some final business to do before they can return home to Africa. He's reluctantly arranged to meet his estranged father, Robert, who has recently got back in touch.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 2
programme.desc: Danny is throwing himself into his work after the death of his father, and has applied for the role of State Vet. However, Danny's attempts to involve Thabo in the first phase of the Lion Breeding Project lead to Du Plessis feeling like an outsider.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Timothy Peart’s Last Dance

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Dead Weight

programme.title: Sliders

programme.title: Sliders

programme.title: Arthur: Buster Isn't Buying It/One Ornery Critter
programme.desc: Aliens, conspiracy theories, the megatoad--Buster believes in everything, until his favorite show gets cancelled for false reporting. Dogs love Arthur! Well, except Carrot Cake. Can Arthur win over this picky pup?

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur Makes Waves/It Came From Beyond
programme.desc: With the community pool closed for repairs and the temperature on the rise, Arthur and D.W. need a place to keep cool. Then, Grandma Thora takes in a stray: an adorable little dog named...Killer?

programme.title: Arthur: To Tibble the Truth/Waiting to Go

programme.title: Arthur: Buster Spaces Out/The Long Road Home
programme.desc: Inspired by footage of the moon landing, Buster wants to go to outer space someday! For now, it'd be cool to build and launch a rocket! Then, after costing Lakewood Elementary the win in a relay race, George wants to redeem himself.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: By the end of the war the RAF had aircraft that could escort bombers to targets deep inside Germany and back. With the Gloster Meteor, the RAF had also entered the ‘Jet Age’. Aircraft like the Hawker Hunter and F-86 Sabre took the RAF supersonic.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: By the end of the First World War the RAF had bombers that could fly to Berlin and back. For the first time in a thousand years British civilians found themselves under direct attack - by Zeppelin airships and Gotha bombers.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: The RAF’s maritime role is often overlooked. Between the wars the RAF operated elegant flying boats to patrol the far flung corners of the Empire.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: After the war, RAF transports helped keep Berliners alive during the Soviet blockade of the city in 1948/49. As well as flying round-the-clock operations into the airport, Sunderland flying boats delivered supplies by landing on Lake Havel near the city.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: In this programme we bring the RAF story into the modern era. Another aircraft to have extended the RAF’s capabilities is the C130 Hercules. This aircraft has proved its capabilities in countless environments from resupply, to dropping paratroopers.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Miranda & Cameryn
programme.desc: After years of online chats Miranda discovered that Cameryn was not the man he claimed to be. She confronted him only to be given another suspicious profile. Is he someone else entirely?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Jeff & Megan
programme.desc: After a string of bad luck with women, Jeff believes he has finally found his dream girl Megan. However, Megan is starting to sound off Catfish alarms.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Bianca & Brogan
programme.desc: When Brogan disappears from the Internet, then returns online after a year without question, Bianca wants to know what happened in the missing year.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Miracle & Javonni
programme.desc: Smart, single mum Miracle fell for Javonni, a dreamy-eyed Instagrammer. With Max on hiatus, Nev teams up with TV personality Charlamagne to take Miracle on a hunt for the man of her dreams. (S4, ep1)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Courtney & Isaak
programme.desc: Courtney broke up with Isaak, who she met online. He's doing everything to get her back. Beauty queen Cassidy Wolf joins Nev to get Isaak to leave Courtney alone for good. (S4, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Lauren & Derek
programme.desc: Lauren met Derek online years ago. Derek is caring, supporting Lauren after she had a baby with a former boyfriend. Lauren thinks Derek could be the one, so why has he avoided meeting her? (S2, ep4)

programme.title: The Hills: I Want You To Be With Me / It's Her Move
programme.desc: Lauren tries to make peace between Brody and Stephanie. Audrina wants to make things work with Corey, but Justin won't give up on her. (S4, ep12)

programme.title: The City: If She Can Make It Here...

programme.title: The City: The Truth Will Reveal Itself

programme.title: The City: The L Word

programme.title: The City: Good Things Come In Threes

programme.title: The City: Boys Night Out

programme.title: The City: He Never Said He Had a Girlfriend
programme.desc: Allie breaks down after a run in with the girl who claims she kissed Adam, but Adam sticks to his story to win Allie back, and Whitney gets upset with Jay for taking Adam's side. (S1, ep6)

programme.title: The City: The Truth Hurts
programme.desc: Kelly Cutrone accuses Allie of being too skinny, and Whitney finds herself caught in the middle. Erin runs into an ex-boyfriend and old feelings begin to return. (S1, ep7)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Goin' South
programme.desc: The Jersey Shore crew is headed to Miami! They are shocked by the surprise arrival of former housemate, Angelina, and the drama picks up right where it left off at the seaside. (S2, ep1)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: The Hangover
programme.desc: Sammi tries to figure out what Ronnie really did at the club the night before. When Angelina interrupts Pauly's game, we see a whole new side of the usually calm Pauly D. (S2, ep2)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Spies, Lies and Secrets
programme.desc: A report about the death of Shane Todd, a brilliant, high-tech engineer at a Singapore company who, according to his parents, was murdered because he was unwilling to share secrets that could harm the United States.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: Elizabeth Welsh's husband, Patrick, left her and their two sons what appeared to be a suicide note and disappeared. After investigating the situation, Elizabeth discovered that Patrick is still alive, living in Texas.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Loved to Death
programme.desc: An investigation into the rise of violence surrounding relationship breakups among adolescents, as detailed in the story of Wayland, Massachusetts teen Lauren Astley, whose last encounter with her football player ex-boyfriend proved to be fatal

programme.title: 48 Hours: Tacoma Confidential
programme.desc: A report on corruption and a cover-up by city officials of Tacoma, Washington, focusing on David Brame, the city’s police chief who rose to power despite a shady past.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Ghosts of Mississippi
programme.desc: A report on a string of unsolved homicides in Columbus, Mississippi. Five elderly residents, all living within a mile of each other, were killed within 18 months. Police say, a terrified community believes a serial killer is on the loose.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Ghosts of El Segundo
programme.desc: In July 1957 Richard Phillips and Milton Curtis, two California police officers on a routine stop, were gunned down by a man who had just committed robbery and rape nearby. Investigators searched for over 45 years for the man who murdered two of their own

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Bunker, Pt. 1
programme.desc: The IMF races a paid killer who is stalking a nuclear scientist forced by the enemy to work on a device that could upset the world power balance in the first of a two-part episode.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Bunker, Pt. 2
programme.desc: While trying to free a nuclear scientist and his wife from enemy hands, the IMF is trapped when a would-be assassin takes over one of Rollin's disguises in Part 2.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Nitro
programme.desc: The IMF finds itself only a second away from eternity when they intercept a nitroglycerine expert who plans to blow up the government house of a small country, thus provoking war with its neighbor nation.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Vault
programme.desc: Guest star Nehemiah Persoff as a corrupt Latin American official plots to loot his own country of $40,000,000 with the connivance of the IMF.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Nicole
programme.desc: Guest star Joan Collins, as a seductive double agent, endangers a vital IMF project when Jim Phelps falls in love with her.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: You Can Count on Me
programme.desc: Barney helps his friends discover just how fun numbers can be by taking them on a number hunt in the park. Baby Bop delights in sharing her favorite number and the kids discover that numbers can be found everywhere.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: All Aboard
programme.desc: Kami, one of Barney's youngest friends, has trouble keeping up with the other kids and she's tired of always being last. She's not having a very good day.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Best In Show - Ducks And Fish
programme.desc: When the kids decide to have a Dog Show to show off their pets, BJ feels a little left out. He doesn't have a dog, and he sure wishes he did! A friend from the park shares her dog with BJ so he can join in the fun.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: A Picture of Friendship
programme.desc: After a brief misunderstanding, BJ realizes he has many friends. He enjoys a day playing with Barney and the children.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Making a Move
programme.desc: Welcome to the neighborhood! Anna has just moved to the neighborhood and is missing her old friends. Barney and his friends help her discover that moving is an adventure with new places to explore and new friends to meet.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Puppy Love
programme.desc: Barney and the kids help Mr. Boyd prepare his dog Bingo for a trip to the veterinarian for a check, while learning lessons about caring for dogs at the same time. Meanwhile, BJ is searching for his missing baseball, which he suspects was buried by Bingo.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: I'm A Builder
programme.desc: When Baby Bop wonders about the noises she hears, Barney explains that the sounds are from big trucks and machines at a nearby construction site. This inspires BJ to build something himself—a wind-up toy robot.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Ryan tries to be just like Barney but soon learns that he is special when he's being himself! Barney explains to Baby Bop that the word "no" can help you avoid making mistakes or getting hurt.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ brings his brand-new toy plane to the park. Baby Bop is having a great time playing with her homemade boat.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Cold Hard Cash
programme.desc: Ton and Allen go North to Alaska and get a cold reception from the local auctioneer. They find two enormous seaplane pontoons and a pair of Smith & Wesson revolvers, including the most powerful production handgun in the world!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Bowling Pin Payday
programme.desc: Allen & Ton visit Ton's old stompin' ground and go head-to-head with a trash-talking auction buyer. They uncover a 19th century rifle with a matching cutlass bayonet and a mechanical bowling pinsetter from the early 1960's!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Wild West
programme.desc: Allen and Ton explain their strategies at a storage auction in San Bernardino, win two units, then have a Pepperbox gun and vintage Lionel train set appraised by experts.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ramped Up
programme.desc: Ton and Allen go head-to-head with their former assistant, Carolyn, while Ton battles a bad back. The guys discover an automatic BB gun and, when negotiations to sell a stunt ramp go south, Allen faces a tough decision.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Sin City Shootout
programme.desc: 1953 Chevy-inspired bumper car; scores of M16 30-round magazines; reproduction 1940s boardwalk photobooth; aerosol-powered spud gun potato launchers.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Wreck-Shaw
programme.desc: Allen drags a starving Ton to a weekend auction and some newbie buyers try to eat up all the profit. Will a rickshaw, a wrecking ball, and blast detonators be enough to satisfy Ton's appetite, or will the guys go home hungry?

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ice, Ice, Baby
programme.desc: Ton and Allen have to get aggressive when they encounter a towering opponent with a mountain of cash. The guys uncover a vintage ice resurfacing machine and an Olympic biathlon rifle!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Everything's Bigger in Texas
programme.desc: Winchester 1886 rifle invented to kill buffalo; collection of 1950s electric Slot Cars.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Early Bird Special
programme.desc: Vintage Shooting Star carnival game; professional Mixed Martial Arts octagon fighting cage.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Trading Places
programme.desc: When an injury sidelines Allen, he stays at the shop while Ton takes Big Sis to the auction and goes rogue, ignoring Allen's advice and making risky purchases that could lose the partners a boatload of cash.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Catch My Drift?
programme.desc: The guys land a custom drift car and a luxury antiques unit that could have a one-of-a-kind pilot pistol from WWI. While trying to track down the provenance of the gun, Ton's lead foot gets them into trouble at their car sale.

programme.title: Christmas Wedding
programme.desc: A month before their wedding, on Christmas Day, Emily is called away for business. When Emily is due to return, a major storm hits making it impossible for her to leave. Emily desperately tries to make it home while Ben gets his act together.

programme.title: A Doggone For christmas
programme.desc: The CIA discovers a puppy with amazing abilities, they force it to become a secret weapon. When the pint-sized Jack Russell is freed from government clutches, he ends up in the loving arms of two brothers just a week before Christmas.

programme.title: One Bad Christmas
programme.desc: Big Earl is the owner of a Christmas tree lot, he has a big heart and big visions. The week before Christmas, his son Derrick, trying to prove to his dad that he is a success, gets into trouble and puts the survival of his dad’s business in jeopardy.

programme.title: Teen Mom 2: Finale Special: Check Up With Dr. Drew
programme.desc: Dr Drew hosts the cast of Teen Mom 2 on-stage in front of a live studio audience. Jenelle, Chelsea, Kailyn and Leah reflect on the struggles of their first year of motherhood.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Uncharted Territory

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Endgame

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Wicked Return

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Checkmate

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers: Killer Cop (Tavernier Case)

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers: Françoise Desnoue Case

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers: Four Lovers For One Crime: The Joël Deprez Affair

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner: Ashes to Ashes

programme.title: Crime Stories: The Conservative Killer

programme.title: Wardens: Operation Check Point

programme.desc: It is Wendy’s birthday, but she insists she doesn’t want any fuss – such as a surprise party. She heads off to start the day’s work, laying a Heritage Trail around the town, and Bob reveals to the Machines that he is not planning a party.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob has a day off and he takes a trip to Farmer Pickles farm to take some photographs for the town photography competition. Wendy, meanwhile, has been called to the school hall where a pipe has burst, threatening the competition.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The team are all ready to set up Mr Sabatini’s bakery opposite the windmill so it’s close to the flour. Bob promises a surprise when they get there, and who should roll out from behind a bush but Benny!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Today Bob and the team have a very exciting job to do. They are building a bridge over the river to where Mr Sabatini’s new bakery will be. Bob promises Scrambler that he can be the first machine across the bridge.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Fothergill has a nasty case of dry rot, so Bob and crew will have to use some smelly chemicals to fix it. As these will affect Mr Fothergill’s allergies, he goes to his sister’s for the day. But she doesn’t get on with Hamish, his pet parrot.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a stormy night, Wendy has to mend a chimney pot at Mrs Potts’, while Bob repairs a drainage pipe for Farmer Pickles. A wire fence has been blown away at the farm too, but fixing the pipe takes priority.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Today’s the day that the machines get to build their brand new shelter. It’s going to be built into the side of a hill and made using found materials. Lofty, who slept outside at the old yard, decides that he’d like a place in the new shelter.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Peter Tobin
programme.desc: Peter Tobin is one of the most notorious serial killers in the UK. From 1991–2006 he raped and murdered three young girls; Dinah McNicol, Vicky Hamilton and Angelika Kluk. Yet even prior to these horrific murders he had a history of violence.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Peter Sutcliffe
programme.desc: Arguably Britain's most infamous serial killer, Peter Sutcliffe became known as The Yorkshire Ripper when he began murdering women in Yorkshire during the 1970s.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Jeremy Bamber
programme.desc: An investigation into Jeremy Bamber's brutal murder of his family in Essex, which occurred in 1985. Sentenced for life, he still maintains he is innocent. Is the right person behind bars?

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: The Russell Murders
programme.desc: Bludgeoned to death whilst walking down a country lane, the horrific murders of Lin and Megan Russell made worldwide news. Discover the events of that shocking day.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Raoul Moat
programme.desc: The hunt for Raoul Moat was one of the largest in British history, after he wounded his ex-girlfriend, killed her new partner and shot and blinded police constable David Rathband.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Never A Bridesmaid
programme.desc: Maya and her partner Darnell decide they want to renew their vows and have a formal wedding ceremony. Joan offers to help with the event and to have it at her home.

programme.title: Girlfriends: The Remains of the Date
programme.desc: Joan is determined to play the ultimate Halloween prank on William and succeeds. Meanwhile, Toni is left to deal with her dates strange sexual fetish for stuffed animals.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Fried Turkey
programme.desc: On a holiday that emphasizes togetherness, Joan struggles with feelings of loneliness and separation on Thanksgiving.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Pregnant Pause

programme.title: Girlfriends: The List
programme.desc: Dreading another dateless weekend, the girls and William try Maya's suggestion to make a list of what they want in a mate.

programme.title: Girlfriends: They’ve Gotta Have It
programme.desc: Joan's new boyfriend Sean has not made a move on her after three weeks of dating and she is beginning to wonder why.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Bad Timing
programme.desc: Joan begins to question her relationship with Sean when he gives her a power drill for Valentine's and doesn't hear from him for three days.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Old Dog
programme.desc: Joan decides it is time to give in on her three-month rule and she is finally going to have sex with her boyfriend Sean.

programme.title: Girlfriends: The Declaration of Lynndependence
programme.desc: Joan and Toni decide that Lynn needs to learn to be independent. They give her a week to find a job, then she is on her own.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Friends, Colleagues, Brothers

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Epiphany
programme.desc: The Taelons announce that they will all go into death stasis and wait on the mother ship for humans to discover how to create core energy and revive them. Zo'or and Da'an don't trust each other to be the last to submit to stasis.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Dark Horizons
programme.desc: Eight Taelons are killed when protectors' implants are re-calibrated with a new imperative to kill instead of protect Taelons. They fear the Jiridians have found a way to control the CVIs. Meanwhile, their core energy continues to deplete.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Point of No Return
programme.desc: When Street solves the 8th dimension of Ma'el's riddle, a beacon leads Liam to a chamber with a healing pool. However, there is only enough in the healing pool to help 6 Taelons. Zo'or will do anything to insure his own life.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Decision
programme.desc: Police captain William Boone is asked to join the security team of Companion Da'an of the Taelon, an alien race that came to earth three years ago.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Secret

programme.title: The Lost World: The Imposters

programme.title: The Lost World: The Elixir
